results.title: Physical Disabilities
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
PGR examines the effects disabilities have on children and their families. One young man whose mother had taken the drug Thalidomide speaks about the effects his disability has had on his life. He has won world records for five of the six events open to armless swimming competitors. He firmly believes anyone can achieve anything they want in life, provided they want it badly enough and are willing to work and persevere in order to achieve their goals. He speaks with sensitivity and humour on the reactions of his peers, his aunt and sister, and his mother, to his disability. His happy and positive nature leaves no doubt he will continue to achieve whatever he sets his mind to.

results.title: Outside Adventures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
PGR presents some of the values and practicalities involved in taking children outside. Sandplay and waterplay are examined, as is the preparation of garden “playscapes”. Gardening is recommended as an outside adventure, and birdwatching in the garden is also discussed. Stories may provide a lead into outdoor activities which exercise both imagination and body. Finally, hints on preparation for a shopping trip and camping expedition in the backyard are provided.

results.title: Difficult Behaviour
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Examines how difficult behaviour can be defined in terms of a child’s development. Can a baby’s behaviour be called difficult? The “terrible two’s” is this a myth or a reality? PGR also suggests strategies that parents can use in coming to terms with any child’s difficult behaviour. The roles of childcare workers, counsellors and play are also explored.

results.title: Parental Self-Esteem
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
It is important for both adults and children that parents maintain their self esteem. PGR examines various aspects of self esteem, including comparisons between reality and media images of parenthood, personal accounts of low self esteem - two mothers describe how they coped with it and survived, and dealing with the effects of unremitting child company. We also look at how and where parents can seek relief should any problems occur.

results.title: Child Care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
This title is introduced by a discussion on babysitting, including co-operatives. We follow this with an introduction to Childcare centres, visiting two centres and talking with both a provider and a user of Family Day Care about this domestic alternative. A third, bi-lingual, Childcare centre is visited, and we describe Childcare Co-operatives. Two parents, a mother and a father, discuss their decisions to care for children full-time at home and we suggest guidelines for choosing and using Childcare facilities.
